thread.title: Quebec mosque shooting suspect returns to court today on murder charges
thread.title_full: Quebec mosque shooting suspect returns to court today on murder charges | Toronto Star

author: The Canadian Press
title: Quebec mosque shooting suspect returns to court today on murder charges
text:
QUEBEC—The man charged in last month’s mosque shootings in Quebec City returns to court today on six counts of first-degree murder and five of attempted murder using a restricted firearm. Alexandre Bissonnette faces the charges in the Jan. 29 deaths of Mamadou Tanou Barry, Ibrahima Barry, Azzeddine Soufiane, Abdelkrim Hassane, Khaled Belkacemi and Aboubaker Thabti.
The six victims, aged between 39 and 60, were killed when a gunman stormed the mosque and opened fire on men who were attending prayer.
Read the latest news on the Quebec mosque shooting 
Nineteen people were wounded in the attack.
  Authorities have refused to specify what type of firearm was used in the mass shooting.
▶ Police vehicles at the scene following a shooting incident at a mosque in Quebec City Sunday night. (The Canadian Press) Read more: Who is Alexandre Bissonnette, the suspect at the centre of the Quebec shooting attack?
